properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the alert notification channel.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of the alert notification channel.

properties.name: is_default
properties.description: (Optional) Is this the default channel for all your alerts.

properties.name: settings
properties.description: (Optional) Additional settings, for full reference lookup Grafana HTTP API documentation.
Note: In settings the strings "true" and "false" are mapped to boolean true and false when sent to Grafana.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: config_json
properties.description: (Required) The JSON configuration for the dashboard.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The data source type. Must be one of the data source keywords supported by the Grafana server.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the data source within the Grafana server.

properties.name: url
properties.description: • url - (Optional) The URL for the data source. The type of URL required varies depending on the chosen data source type.

properties.name: is_default
properties.description: • is_default - (Optional) If true, the data source will be the default source used by the Grafana server. Only one data source on a server can be the default.

properties.name: basic_auth_enabled
properties.description: • basic_auth_enabled - (Optional) - If true, HTTP basic authentication will be used to make requests.

properties.name: basic_auth_username
properties.description: • basic_auth_username - (Required if basic_auth_enabled is true) The username to use for basic auth.

properties.name: basic_auth_password
properties.description: • basic_auth_password - (Required if basic_auth_enabled is true) The password to use for basic auth.

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Required by some data source types) The username to use to authenticate to the data source.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Required by some data source types) The password to use to authenticate to the data source.

properties.name: json_data
properties.description: • json_data - (Required by some data source types) The default region and authentication type to access the data source. json_data is documented in more detail below.

properties.name: secure_json_data
properties.description: • secure_json_data - (Required by some data source types) The access and secret keys required to access the data source. secure_json_data is documented in more detail below.

properties.name: database_name
properties.description: • database_name - (Required by some data source types) The name of the database to use on the selected data source server.

properties.name: access_mode
properties.description: • access_mode - (Optional) The method by which the browser-based Grafana application will access the data source. The default is "proxy", which means that the application will make requests via a proxy endpoint on the Grafana server.
JSON Data (json_data) supports the following:

properties.name: auth_type
properties.description: • auth_type - (Required by some data source types) The authentication type type used to access the data source.

properties.name: default
properties.description: • default - (Required by some data source types) The default region for the data source.

properties.name: custom_metrics_namespaces
properties.description: • custom_metrics_namespaces - (Optional, for the CloudWatch data source type) A comma-separated list of custom namespaces to be queried by the CloudWatch data source.

properties.name: assume_role_arn
properties.description: • assume_role_arn - (Optional, for the CloudWatch data source type) The role ARN to be assumed by Grafana when using the CloudWatch data source.
Secure JSON Data (secure_json_data) supports the following:

properties.name: access_key
properties.description: • access_key - (Required by some data source types) The access key required to access the data source.

properties.name: secret_key
properties.description: • secret_key - (Required by some data source types) The secret key required to access the data source.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: title
properties.description: (Required) The title of the folder.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The display name for the Grafana organization created.

properties.name: admin_user
properties.description: • admin_user - (Optional) The login name of the configured default admin user for the Grafana installation. If unset, this value defaults to admin, the Grafana default. Grafana adds the default admin user to all organizations automatically upon creation, and this parameter keeps Terraform from removing it from organizations.

properties.name: create_users
properties.description: • create_users - (Optional) Whether or not to create Grafana users specified in the organization's membership if they don't already exist in Grafana. If unspecified, this parameter defaults to true, creating placeholder users with the name, login, and email set to the email of the user, and a random password. Setting this option to false will cause an error to be thrown for any users that do not already exist in Grafana.
This option is particularly useful when integrating Grafana with external authentication services such as auth.github and auth.google.

properties.name: admins
properties.description: • admins - (Optional) A list of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given admin access to the organization. Note: users specified here must already exist in Grafana unless 'create_users' is set to true.

properties.name: editors
properties.description: • editors - (Optional) A list of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given editor access to the organization. Note: users specified here must already exist in Grafana unless 'create_users' is set to true.

properties.name: viewers
properties.description: • viewers - (Optional) A list of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given viewer access to the organization. Note: users specified here must already exist in Grafana unless 'create_users' is set to true.
A user can only be listed under one role-group for an organization, listing the same user under multiple roles will cause an error to be thrown.

Note - Users specified for each role-group (admins, editors, viewers) should be listed in ascending alphabetical order (A-Z). By defining users in alphabetical order, Terraform is prevented from detecting unnecessary changes when comparing the list of defined users in the resource to the (ordered) list returned by the Grafana API.
